content: I understand your frustration and empathize with your difficulty in adjusting to the nuances of Mandarin Chinese. However, it is vital to recognize that linguistics and grammar are not arbitrary; they evolve based on the needs of speakers over time. Mandarin Chinese developed in a different way than English, and its rules reflect the way that native speakers of Mandarin Chinese conceive of the world around them. Ultimately, whether or not one finds learning Mandarin rewarding is a personal choice, but many people take the time to learn Mandarin Chinese to appreciate and understand this unique and fascinating language, culture and people.
